content: Section 11 of this document outlines penalties for violating the regulations and orders issued under this Act. It is unlawful to violate, attempt to violate, conspire to violate, or cause a violation of any regulation or order issued under this Act. Civil penalties can be imposed on a person for each violation, including a fine of up to $250,000 or twice the value of the transaction that is the basis of the violation, whichever is greater. Criminal penalties can also be imposed, including fines of up to $1,000,000 and imprisonment for up to 20 years for individuals, as well as forfeiture of any property used or intended to be used to commit or facilitate the violation.
